meanings.definition: To remove stitches from (a piece of fabric)
meanings.sent1: She was unstitching the hem of her dress to make it shorter.
meanings.sent2: I will be unstitching the buttons from the old shirt to reuse them.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was helping by unstitching the pillow with its claws.
meanings.sent4: The detective was unstitching the lies to reveal the truth.
meanings.sent5: The tailor's precise unstitching made the garment good as new.

meanings.definition: The act of undoing stitches in (a piece of fabric)
meanings.sent1: Her careful unstitching of the seam saved the fabric from damage.
meanings.sent2: The unstitching of the embroidery revealed a hidden message underneath.
meanings.sent3: The unstitching of the quilt accidentally created a new pattern.
meanings.sent4: The unstitching of the tapestry symbolized the unraveling of a mystery.
meanings.sent5: The slow unstitching of the fabric showed the craftsmanship of the original work.
